params.text: Eggplant (Solanum melongena L.) originated from India but it also grown as vegetable throughout the tropical, sub-tropical and warm temperate areas such as India, China, Japan, and in the Philippines.

Eggplant is a day-neutral plant and popularly used in the Filipino diet. Eggplant is called various names such as aubergine and brinjal (English,) talong (Tagalog), tarong (Ilocano) or bringhinas (Bisaya).

The crop can be grown both during dry and wet seasons as long as the drainage system is considered for the latter. Off-season production is done because of high price which gives high income and also to meet the consumer’s demand.

params.text:
NUTRITIVE VALUE AND USES OF EGGPLANT
 
Eggplant is grown for its immature fruits which are pickled, dehydrated, roasted, fried or stuffed, and cooked as curry. It can also be eaten in raw form. White eggplants are good for diabetic patients and can cure toothache due to its medical properties. The table below is the nutrient properties of 100 g edible portion of eggplant fruit.
 
PROPERTIES AMOUNT
Water 92g
Calcium 22g
Protein 1.6g
Fat  0.2g
Fiber 1.0g
Carbohydrates 4.0g
Iron 0.9mg
Vitamin B1 0.08mg
Vitamin B2 0.07mg
Niacin 0.7mg
Vitamin C 6mg
Energy value 100kj
Calories 24
Sulfur 44.0mg
Chlorine 52.0mg
Vitamin A 124 I.U.
Thiamine 0.04
Riboflavin 0.11
Beta carotene 0.9m
Oxalic acid 18.0mg
Magnesium 16.0mg
Phosphorus 47.0mg
Sodium 3.0mg
Copper 0.17mg
Potassium 2.0
Source: Siemonsma J.S. and Piluek, K. (Editors). 1994. PROSEA Handbook No. 8. Vegetables. Pudok, Wageningen. 1993/Prosea, Bogor and AVRDC (cited by BPI).
 
 
The oblong-fruited eggplant cultivars contain rich total soluble sugar, anthocyanin, phenols, glycoalkaloids (such as solasodine), dry matter, and amide proteins. 
  High dry matter content and low level of phenolic of the fruits are for processing purposes. In general, the fruits of the plants under Solanaceae family have bitter taste and off-flavor due to high content of glycoalkaloids (20 mg/100 g fresh weight). However, for Indian commercial cultivars, glycoalkaloids vary from 0.37 mg/100 g fresh weight to 4.83 mg. High polyphenol oxidase activity results to discoloration of eggplant. Least susceptible cultivars to discoloration are for processing purposes. The long purple with green calyx is the most preferred but others prefer the long or round green-colored varieties.

questions:
1. Eggplant is originated from *India* but it also grown as vegetable throughout the *tropical*, *sub-tropical* and *warm* temperate areas such as India.

2. The *oblong-fruited* eggplant cultivars contain rich total soluble sugar, anthocyanin, phenols, glycoalkaloids (such as solasodine), dry matter and amide proteins.

3. The fruits of the plants under *Solanaceae* family have *bitter* taste and off-flavor due to high content of glycoalkaloids.

params.text: Selection of a quality planting material is the key to successful production by planting a variety or cultivar as recommended by reliable Seed Companies and the National Seed Industry Council (NSIC).  The suitability of the variety to the existing conditions of the area should be considered. Prior planting, the characteristics of the variety are considered that adapts with the existing conditions of the area. The chemical and physical properties of the soil and favorable socio-economic conditions are also considered for reasonable production.

The criteria considered to successful production are high yield, maturity, and marketability, eating quality, resistance/tolerance to insect pests and diseases, and adaptability. 

 

The list of NSIC registered eggplant varieties is presented in Appendix Table 1. There are also hybrid varieties of eggplant bred by various seed companies available in the market that can be planted by the farmers.

panels.title: Criteria in the Selection of Varieties

params.text:
Eggplant can be grown successfully throughout the year at low to mid elevations and any type of soil with pH ranging from 5.5 to 6.8. A deep, fertile and well- drained sandy or silt loam soils with high organic matters contribute to better crop production. Eggplant is susceptible to root rot, hence, a sandy loam soil is ideal especially when early yield is desired. 

 

  • Eggplant is a warm-season crop, day-neutral plant, and requires optimum temperature of 21 to 29°C for growth and fruit development, at the maximum of 35°C and minimum 18°C.
  • The optimum soil temperature for seed germination is 24°–32°C.
  • Eggplant is intolerant to frost and growth is retarded when night temperatures are below 16°C.
  • The crop is resistant to drought and excessive rainfall. At flowering stage, both cool temperature and low light intensity can cause pollen viability and failure fruit set.
  • The crop becomes vegetative if both temperature and relative humidity is high.
